website_summaries.verdict: Reliable storage bags, which are pre-sealed and lay flat for easy storage.
pros: Comes with a pouch for carrying bags
Bags hold up well in the freezer
Good price for a pack of 100 bags
Won't fall over or rip in the freezer
Zip closure is very secure and doesn't leak
cons: These bags cannot be directly attached to your pump
Milk must be poured from the bottle into the bags

customer_reviews.title: My favorite! Strong seal and strong plastic
customer_reviews.text: My favorite! Strong seal and strong plastic. Great when thawing out stored milk because the plastic isn’t as cheap and flimsy as others.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag
customer_reviews.text: These bags are better than the pump and save bag. The bags are better constructed and are stronger. The bags are wider and shorter than the avent bags that I usually use. I like the fact that the holes to direct pump are no longer there, however there isn't a spout to pour the milk. The material is very strong and not flexible which makes pouring the milk into the bottle a little difficult. You just have to pour carefully. The bag did well in the freezer and defrosting. Overall, I would recommend the bag.
customer_reviews.author: JAY B.

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed with the product change!
customer_reviews.text: I love these bags! I didn’t realize they had changed the product, but I LOVE them! They’re huge, the zip seal is much sturdier than the old bags, which is nice because less stress about losing precious milk! My only complaint is for some reason you have to rip the top off before pouring the milk in, and they no longer have the slots so you can pump straight into the bag. 10/10 would still recommend though!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Knudson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: 2nd time ordering, the 1st batch was excellent but this 2nd go round, Several of the bags have a white residue on them. I was afraid to use them so I just clean each bag with mild soap. And two of them so far has leaked on me. I think I will just get some other bags. update: I am currently using Target brand bags but I opened another pack of these medela bags and it's still white residue on all of them and a horrible chemical smell. I will send them back because I'm not wasting $15 on bags that i cannot use.
customer_reviews.author: pebbles

customer_reviews.title: I hate these bags. I wasted so much milk!
customer_reviews.text: These bags keep breaking. I have stored my bags flat on my freezer with only 4oz per bag and about half of them have ripped and as soon as I try to defrost my milk it all leaks out. It is heartbreaking. I’m drying up and trying really hard to make it to 12 breastfeeding babies. Only to find that a big portion of my dwindling freezer stash is ruined. I can’t stress enough how terrible these bags are. I wish I had never bought them and had stuck with lansinoh. I also agree with the fact that they smell. Something I didn’t notice until too late unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

customer_reviews.title: Inside of these bags smells super weird/like plastic chemicals.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what they did with the new design, but the plastic smell inside the bag after you tear off the top is HORRIBLE. I'm switching to another brand. I don't feel comfortable with my baby drinking out of something that smells that way, even if it's BPA-free. Not sure if it's the dye or what--the outside of the bag does not smell? Very strange. Not buying again, though.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Can’t pump directly into
customer_reviews.text: Be careful. These are not the ones you can pump directly into. I wasted my money buying these. Grrr. I love that I can shop online while I’m stuck at home with a newborn but I hate how many things I keep getting wrong. I wish Amazon had better descriptions. I probably overlooked it but they rarely go into the kind of detail I need to make sure I’m buying
customer_reviews.author: AmazonWoman

customer_reviews.title: The loudest milk bags ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to be totally honest. I hate these milk storage bags. They're SO loud. To get them open to put your milk in or to take it out and pour into a bottle is like opening a bag of potato chips. When you have a newborn, noises like this aren't really our friends! The plastic is super stuff and the zip lock part is not easy to use at all. Plus I don't believe the bags are recyclable. I've used other brands that can go in your recycling can and I'd prefer those. I can't wait to just finally be done with these already so I can buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% effective !
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved these bags. I've been pumping for 5 months now and have tried many different brands of bags. From Avent, lanisho, to the target brand. But after trying them all these are the only ones that leak!. So far the target brand bags are the best. These are no good because out of the 5 boxes I have purchased there has been about 40bags that leak after defrosting my baby's precious milk!
customer_reviews.author: Y_tu_mamatambien

customer_reviews.title: Measurements are off
customer_reviews.text: Great for storing milk, double seal is great, compact and lays flat in the freezer! I think the measuring quantity is off on the bags... I pumped 30mL and it was showing I had 3oz on the bag, Do not go off of bag fluid measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great size but doesn't connect to pump
customer_reviews.text: I loved these bags because they after much larger thang the regular Medela bags I have seen in stores and much more affordable. However they do not connect to the Medela pump directly, forcing you to still pump until a bottle and transfer it into a bottle. For someone that has to ash bottles by hand is very inconvenient. The bag is labeled up to 6 ounces but can actually hold almost 10.
customer_reviews.author: Malroy86

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend :-(
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a nice stash of milk in my freezer all in these bags. So you can imagine my disappointment when I go to thaw some milk and it has a very strong plastic/chemical smell. My baby won’t drink a single drop and I don’t blame him. I’ve thawed about 5 bags now and the milk all has the same strong plastic smell. I’m really sad but it seems I will need to throw away several months worth of frozen breastmilk, which is very time consuming to pump. Super super sad and bummed that I gave these a try. I would definitely not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: catsutsui

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bags
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality and freezer friendly. Measuring bars are accurate. I kept my milk in the freezer (laying flat) for several weeks and when thawed these bags didn’t leak. I portion my freshly expressed breastmilk into these bags, 4oz per bag and just pop a bag into container with hot water to warm up. We don’t use microwave and always have hot water in our water dispenser so heating milk is really quick in these bags, much quicker than heating the bottle. Never once I had a bag leaking. I do feel like the value for the $ could be better compared to other good quality bags out there.
customer_reviews.author: La Vida Loca

customer_reviews.title: Great quality bags
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Medela rocks and I’m so happy my pump was covered through my insurance. This is the best price I found on the bags. I don’t even pump into the bottles anymore. I just fit the bag around the membrane and pump straight into the bag. They fit well in the freezer and to thaw them I just run them under hot water for a few minutes. I haven’t had any issues with bags tearing/leaking/etc. I will definitely be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Leaky leaky leaky
customer_reviews.text: So frustrating. I’m a donor and our recipients have let us know that these bags are the worst about leaking. It’s heartbreaking when there’s so much work going into this precious resource, just to have it ruined (yes, we cry over spilt milk 😭) The only good thing is that the zipper seal is really strong. Definitely sturdier than most. But it’s difficult to pour into the bag because the plastic wants to stay stuck together and the top isn’t as wide to pour into. This results in milk spilling on the outside. Not impressed and will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: rkbuffy

customer_reviews.title: I prefer Lanisoh
customer_reviews.text: These bags are absolutely leak proof if you make sure the ziplock is closed.the plastic is nice and thick. I still prefer the Lanisoh bags, though. That’s because you can lay Lanisoh bags on their side to freeze them, and it makes them easier to stack in a shoebox. The Medela bags have a more triangular shape for the milk, and it makes them hard to stack.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mary

customer_reviews.title: I hate these bags.
customer_reviews.text: Look, they securely store breast milk. That's great. But the plastic they're made from and the design of the bag makes it hard to keep the bag open and pour the milk into the bag. I always end up hitting the zipper seal or along the inside of the bag above the closure point. In addition, they DO NOT freeze flat, no matter what I do. The edges of the plastic bag are rough and in general I'd gladly pay a little extra for different bags.
customer_reviews.author: Roslyn

customer_reviews.title: Constantly leaking. Wasting milk!!!
customer_reviews.text: So upset about how much milk is being wasted. These are great at first. Easy to put milk into and put into freezer. As I am pulling milk out of the freezer to thaw about 90% of the bags are leaking. So I now am consistently cleaning breastmilk from all over my fridge and milk is being wasted!! I will be going with a different product from now on and I have bought so many boxes from them with both my kids. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda C.

customer_reviews.title: I like the stiffness for keeping milk upright and standing
customer_reviews.text: I honestly like these bags. I don’t need a spout to pour into them. I just open it and I’m able to pour from the bottle into the bag while holding a squirming baby. I don’t use the measurements on the bag at all because it’s crazy inaccurate and if I depended on it, I would take a star or two away from the review. I use the measurements of milk from the bottle and write it on the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Cathryn

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Since April I have ordered the 100 pack bags 4 times. I highly recommend these bags I freeze them flat and upright. These bags do not leak they are very sturdy and easy to pour. And I think they are very reasonable I have to purchase a box a month. A few times I add more than 6 oz to the bag and it does not leak. I have tried many breast milk storage bags and by far this brand is the best.
customer_reviews.author: L. Vample

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to use/mark/read.
customer_reviews.text: I find that if these are sealed correctly (no milk stuck in zipper) these have held up through the filling, freezing, and defrosting process. When filling these, if you open them up and make sure the bottom is all the way open they will stand a little easier and make the filling process easier. I use the Medela pump, Medela bottles, and Medela breastmilk bags but use Dr. Browns bottles for feeding. I find these bags markings are pretty useless as there is very little consistency once they are filled. I always mark these bags based off of what the Medela bottles read.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Nikki

customer_reviews.title: My favorite breast milk bags
customer_reviews.text: I have been exclusively pumping for almost 6 months so I have tried A LOT of pumping products. These bags are my favorite for a lot of reasons. First, storage capacity. They say they are 6 ounces but I can fit up to 10 ounces in them. Now, I only store my milk in the fridge, I don't freeze it, but I wouldn't go beyond the 6 ounces for freezing. Second, they stand up great when filled. Third, the material is very strong. Fourth, you can easily write on the bags. I've had other brands that were so difficult to write on. They seal really well, too. And, lastly, they are a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Girl

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Extra Pennies
customer_reviews.text: I love these bags. I may be slightly biased because I received the pump from the same company and these bags came with it but I also had a sample of other bags and they just don't compare. These are sturdy and durable. I have had no issues with leaks even with some milk getting in the zipper. They also can stand up when liquid is in them. I've froze at least 4 ounces at a time max and they stay pretty flat. Worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: April Warner

customer_reviews.title: I’ll be going back to lansinoh
customer_reviews.text: Do not like the rigid plastic. The opening is harder to navigate compared to popular alternative. Why are some style bags compatable with pump and others not? They should all be compatable. This set me back so that I have to pour from pump bottle to bag and that’s messy. The zip top isn’t super easy to press together either and I question its leak proof ability. I weigh my ounces for accuracy, no comment on that. I did like the stand up design of bag, but it makes it hard to lay flat for storage
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: BEST milk bags
customer_reviews.text: Medela milk bags are pricier but I have found out that they are worth it if you are able to spend a couple extra dollars. You can tell that a great deal of time was dedicated to make sure that these bags are the best quality that they can be. The seal feels sturdy and I love the plastics quality. When it’s something as valuable as breast milk you have to make sure you are choosing wisely, especially when it can mean loosing hours of hard work. I have also learned that these bags are the easiest to write on with pen. Overall, I recommend to all breastfeeding mommas!
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Great, convenient bags... a couple had holes, so beware!
customer_reviews.text: This is truly a great product! Well worth it to have to store breast milk in the freezer. It's also very easy to warm milk in these. Simply put a bag of frozen milk in hot water for a couple of minutes, and it's ready to pour into a bottle and serve. I have ordered a couple boxes of these, and a few of them have had several bags with small tears. Just beware as you're pouring milk in to see if any leaks out. It's liquid gold, so losing any of it is tragic. Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with these bags!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: They have a line for scissors to cut the top in order to pour in. Scissors!? No. I can’t have to remember to have scissors in my bag along with the 1,993,324 other things I have to pack. You can tear it by hand but it becomes uneven. Also hard to pour in. I’m actually super disappointed. Although they do seem leak proof. Additionally, I don’t recommend storing 6 Oz in them if you want to freeze flat because it doesn’t let the bag go completely flat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No leaks, lie flat
customer_reviews.text: I switched from Nuk brand to these accidentally when the store was out of Nuk. That was at least 4 or 5 months ago, and I haven’t gone back. I have no complaints about Nuk, but these are thicker and hold their shape better, so as long as you freeze them flat, they stay nice and flat without lumps. Plus, they stand up on their own. :) Haven’t had a single leak (except ONCE when the bag wasn’t sealed properly). Breastmilk is precious and these bags do a good job protecting it.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, doesn't freeze flat with >6oz
customer_reviews.text: These can hold the 8oz that I like to put in, and stand up great while I fill it, but they don't freeze flat when I put in that much (might be my fault for overloading it). I prefer the Nuk seal n go bags because they freeze flatter for me. Otherwise, these are great. They don't leak, are sealed and sterile, stand up for filling, and are very thick so they feel very sturdy. I also like the label because it is easy to write on. I just wish it froze flatter for me.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great for freezing milk
customer_reviews.text: I love that these bags seal tight and can hold a lot of milk! They also thaw quickly when put in hot water. You can write on the bag with a pen or marker and it doesn’t smudge. My only complaint is that the measurements on the bag don’t add up to the right amount unless you have the full 6oz in the bag. For example: 2oz can like 4oz. I just have to keep track of how much I am putting in the bags before I freeze them so I don’t get confused. It’s not a big deal for me and I will buy more because they are a great price and they work very well for freezing.
customer_reviews.author: Nbirdj

customer_reviews.title: Great for freezing breast milk
customer_reviews.text: Love these bags! I’m only pumping this time around (breastfeeding my first son was a disaster!) and these bags are a great. They accommodate up to 6 oz of breast milk. You don’t want to put more in or else you run the risk of them cracking or expanding too much when you freeze them. They freeze flat allowing you to store them better in the freezer. They stand upright during the thawing process which is helpful in a packed fridge! Easy to pour once the milk has thawed. Will definitely be ordering these again!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: What's that weird smell??
customer_reviews.text: I bought two packs of Milk Storage Bags, I opened a few and inside there is a very strong chemical smell. should I be worried?? I tested other bags from a different pack, same strong chemical odor that gave me a headache. is this normal? I posted the same review on Medela's official website and that's the email I got back quote: "Our staff has read your review and values your contribution even though it did not meet all of our guidelines. Thanks for sharing, and we hope to publish next time!"... which made me worry even more.
customer_reviews.author: shai bachar

customer_reviews.title: No leaks, great value, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love these bags. Easy to get out excess air so they will be flat in freezer and I’ve never had a problem with leaking since i use these for work on a 10hr day. Only things i don’t like is that you have to make sure you open up the bottom of the bags (pouch) to make sure it will read the right measurement AND you have to cut the bags before you even open that that’s very inconvenient because sometimes i forget to do it before i go to work.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible smell! Don't store your precious breastmilk in these.
customer_reviews.text: These bags have terrible plastic/chemical smell in them and they effect the breastmilk. I have over 100 oz of breastmilk that is going down the drain since my baby actually notice the difference and will not drink it. I even tried to air out the bag before storage, and it does not make a difference. Don't waste your money on these or suffer the same consequence I did! As others noted, this bad is easy to use and the material is durable, but those aspects are useless if the breastmilk is going to spoil inside!
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to store & inaccurate volume markings
customer_reviews.text: First - my pumping bottles will show 4 oz of breastmilk collected, a measuring cup will show slightly more (~4.25 oz) but these bags will show ~5+ oz once that same amount of milk is poured in. When I pour in 5 oz, it shows the milk above the 'do not fill' mark... so that's confusing and not fun. Also, these bags are so stiff at the bottom that they do not lay flat in the freezer. The Lansinoh bags (whose volume markings also don't match the measuring cup) lay nice and flat in the freezer & then once frozen, are easy to transfer upright into freezer bags for efficient storing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I'd be so happy I'd have to write a review on bags ! The brand I had before was terrible to open, that I always used scissors to cut it and pour milk out of the bag. The zipper part was slippery and could barely catch it. The Medela bags have a lil grip at the top that steadies the fingers to pry bag open. When You're holding a baby and trying to fix a bottle at the same time, that lil feature is pure gold. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: Good bag with some caveats
customer_reviews.text: Pros; thick and sturdy, easy to write on- I like that the label is right side up, easy to pour into and pour out of bc of the thickness of the bag, freezes flat Cons; expensive, have to be careful to seal the zipper all the way so they don't leak, slight plastic smell it hasn't seemed to affect my milk though. Overall I'll keep buying these, the cheaper options also seem more flimsy. I wish these had a double zipper like the lansinoh.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Best Milk Storage Bags!
customer_reviews.text: Best milk storage bag I've used! I didn't like the flimsy feel of the lansinoh bags or the Wal-Mart store brand. These are a lot thicker, which can make storing larger volumes tricky, so I generally kept it to 4-5oz per bag and didn't have an issue if I laid them flat to freeze. I also loved that they would stand on their own without tipping. Definitely recommend using these bags!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse C.

customer_reviews.title: you want liquid sealed- this is it
customer_reviews.text: ok i use these for other purposes. my primary concern is seal over rough handling. there are pros and cons of these. as the double 'click' seals are somewhat rigid- they do secure the contents in (dry outside) but you really need to use fingers to make sure they are all the way locked. once you do, it is fail proof. if mistaken, it is your fault not the bags. like i said, you have put your labor in it. i dont see any alternative better than these to secure liquid in.
customer_reviews.author: Thegrove

customer_reviews.title: Don't look at the description or you'll be fooled
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I realize now that these bags are not at all what I was looking for, which were the Pump and Save bags specifically. So these night be great if you're looking for just regular old breast milk storage bags. But the description of this product is really deceptive in that it specifically mentions and pictures the pump and save bags. So basically now I've got another hundred bags that I can't pump directly into which sucks, but I'll survive.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: doesn’t work for long term freezer storage
customer_reviews.text: I used these bags over the course of a year. They worked fine for short term storage, but developed cracks In the bags in the freezer that lead to leaking after defrosting. I also thought it was hard to get excess air out which led to more ice crystals forming on my milk than I would like. I also think the milk had a plastic like smell and taste after defrosting. In summary, works fine for short term storage but would not recommend for freezer long term storage.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Almost leak proof...
customer_reviews.text: Used a ton of these for storing breast milk. Filled to 4oz. They store great and are very compact and convenient. Unfortunatly as we have gone through defrosting frozen supplies, we have noticed about 20% of the bags end up developing a leak at the bottom corner of the pouch. This allows milk to leak out during defrosting. We have lost several ounces of milk due to this despite attempts to watch for the failure and catch the bad bags early. Still a great product...but design/qc needs some attention.
customer_reviews.author: Dukie564

customer_reviews.title: Better than Lasinoh, IMO
customer_reviews.text: I love these storage bags. I’ve been using the Medela bags and Lasinoh and I must say that these are much sturdier and stand up straight in the fridge a lot better. If you’re only using them for freezing, the Lasinoh brand are just fine, but if you plan on using them in the fridge as well, I’d recommend paying extra for the Medela. The material is thicker and doesn’t bend as easily. They’re also wider and don’t tip over as much.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Berry

customer_reviews.title: Best breast milk storage bag out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to breast milk storage bag! It’s extremely sturdy/strong! It will not tear or break when you freeze and defrost your milk! The new design ensures that the baggies are new and unused. You have to cut the top off in order to pour your breast milk in but I don’t mind it. I actually prefer that since it is a way to keep your baggies sanitary until you use them. 10/10! I will keep purchasing this item
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Won't be a repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: Ehhh. I like Lansinoh bags much more. I'm not a fan of the plastic used to make them. It's a stiff plastic vs. soft and bendable. They are a pain to open compared to others and I don't like the label either. I like the double zip close but also find them difficult to close. I do really like the bottoms of the bags. They aren't flat so I find measurement much more accurate than any other I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Jenibee1019

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and Correct to measurement
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bags. They are very easy to open and pour milk in and out of the bag. I think the other reviews about the measurements being wrong are because of not opening and stretching them correctly. I know this becoz I did not open the base correctly and my 4 0z in the bottle came upto 6oz in the bag and was very bummed. then the next time I opened the base first, made sure the bag is standing correctly and then held the bag and poured the milk, TaDaaa.. perfect measurement. I haven't used any other bags, so cannot compare against any others but I am satisfied with the product and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks! Waste!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are absolute trash. I am so upset that I bought more, not knowing that they leak leak leak and break! I have had 3 bags completely bust / break for no apparent reason. I have to place the bags in a bowl when I thaw them now because I can never be sure if the bag will actually hold up post- freeze. Buy something else if you want to actually use your hard-earned liquid gold.
customer_reviews.author: M. K. Haskin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use. Prefer over Lansinoh
customer_reviews.text: This product stands up on its own much better than Lansinoh. It's easier to use. Easier to seal. Overall I love it. There is one downside. If you don't write how much is in there there would really be no way to know. I'll put five oz in there when its standing up and it looks like 6. I'll put 4 oz in there it'll line up with the five. Sometimes it fills up the entire bag. Luckily I use bottles with measurements when I pump otherwise I'd never know.
customer_reviews.author: K.T.S.

customer_reviews.title: NOT LEAK PROOF
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Not very accurate, but that’s not the problem. I started thawing them recently and found 25-50% of them leak. Obviously if they have holes, there’s a chance they’re contaminated, so not only were the bags a waste of money, but now I’m out hundreds of ounces of milk, maybe over a thousand as I haven’t gotten through all the bags yet. Obviously you know how frustrating spilling a few ounces is, imagine a few hundred. Milk I cannot get back, and if I lose my supply my daughter might need to start formula because of this. I would NOT recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Cannot pump directly into bag
customer_reviews.text: These bags appear durable. The downside to these which I didn't realize while buying is that yiu cannot pump directly into the bag. I had other medela bags which fit with the adapter and you can pump directly into them which saves for having to transfer. For this reason I rated them 3 stars. Otherwise if you don't mind pouring the milk in they seem to be durable and have not leaked so far
customer_reviews.author: JMM

customer_reviews.title: Easy, air tight and no leaks
customer_reviews.text: I love that these are sealed before using. So sanitary! These bags are great and so easy to use. I store mine standing up (they’re designed to stand) in a Plastic bowl in my freezer. I’m paranoid about breast milk leaking and being wasted but these seem air tight and leak proof. You can’t pump directly into the bag, you’ll risk spilling, but just pump in your normal bottles and pour it in.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: great! great! great!
customer_reviews.text: I love these breastmilk storage bags! My deep Fridge is loaded with milk. I pump into my bottle and pour into the bag after pumping. It says for safety fill no more than 6oz of milk in there...but believe it or not I have maxed the bag with 10oz. I carefully zip it up when it is maxed with 10oz. Never had and bursting or leak when maxed. The picture shows a frozen bag of breastmilk. When it has been defrost, it pours out nicely into a bottle without any hassle or mess. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: ~♡Silk☆~

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: These bags are easy to use, don’t make a huge mess and freeze well. They seem pretty durable. I use a permanent marker to write on them and have no issue with it smudging. I’m not so sure it’s completely accurate using the measurements on the outside of the bag, but I measure before I place in the bag and write how much I’m storing inside the bag. So not a big deal for me. Overall these are good quality bags. The price is decent too.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: No leaks
customer_reviews.text: I have so far, after 1 month, had no problem with these bags. They store well and stack well when frozen flat. It's funny because one friend told me I have to get Lansinoh because Medela bags are terrible and leak, and another friend told me I have to get Medela because Lansinoh bags are terrible and leak. I flipped a coin and got these and have had no leaks, they are easy to use. I was under the assumption that you could pump directly into all Medela bags but maybe that's another model and I didn't get the right ones? Because these do not go onto the Medela symphony pump
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Yeung

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Babe is 11 months old and these are the only bags I’ve used except when we bought Nuk on sale (which we won’t buy again). Pros: Thick plastic, feels strong Stands up great on their own Film on label area so you can write with a ballpoint pen, doesn’t have to be a permanent marker I like that they’re individually sealed. Only con: Incorrect measurement markings but I pump into bottles and measure from there. We haven’t had any leaks except when we have frozen them and then put in our bottle warmer BUT I can’t be sure they hadn’t been dropped when frozen, which definitely would have weakened the bags and could have caused it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly P

customer_reviews.title: The woooorst
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst. If you have a preemie or immune-compromised baby, you may need the extra protection of a complete seal. For me, I don't get why they can't be perforated. You have to cut them with scissors, which is pretty inconvenient. Also, they do not pour well from the bag. It's some weird voodoo that makes them crumple on themselves and alternately pour nothing and everything from the bag.
customer_reviews.author: cbrice

customer_reviews.title: Very well sealed bags, but bubbles can be hard to squeeze out
customer_reviews.text: This is very goto breast milk storage bag. I find it seals very well, and you can feel this is a thick bag when you use it. The measurement is pretty accurate. The process how to use it is straight forward, but I find it really hard to squeeze all bubble out of the bag, that is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. I would wish Medela could find a creative way to solve the bubble problem.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Qi

customer_reviews.title: Do not use these bags!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these bag with the understanding they would keep my milk fresh in a freezer. I have been storing them in a deep freeze with nothing in it but the Breast Milk. It total I storaged 3 months of Milk supply. When i started to pull the milk to use it, the bag on the inside sink and the milk does as well. It is actually all of the bag. They smell like pour plastic. All of the hard work I put into it has gone to waste. ALL!!!!! Because of the smell I do not trust giving it to my child. I am extremely dissappointed and will never pay these bags again.
customer_reviews.author: Nervz

customer_reviews.title: Crying over spilt milk
customer_reviews.text: These breast milk storage bags are horrible. Never in my life have I spilled so much breast milk while trying to put milk into the bags to store than with these. They are too rigid and the opening at the top is not wide enough to get medela bottles into to dump milk into the bags. If you want to cry over spilt milk then these are the bags for you. If you want to actually pump milk for your child and not dump it on the counter or floor I recommend going with a different brand
customer_reviews.author: Nikki West

customer_reviews.title: I've gone through 200, no problems yet
customer_reviews.text: These bags are easy to use, easy to fill, easy to thaw. No problems yet with leaks. As with all bags, the measurements on the bags are not really accurate (depends on the bag being fully open, etc.); you should go off the measurement on the bottles you pump into. I do not recommend filling past 5 ounces; other brands are better if you want to freeze larger quantities.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: If you need storage bags for breast milk, this is your bag! I have gone though so many different brands, I have to say that this takes the cake!! Easy to use, and most importantly, the time it takes to warm up the milk when baby is screaming, just can’t be beat! It warms milk up fast! It also stands up to help flprwvent spilled milk! (Which I’d you have ever spilt milk when you pump, you cry about haha!!) 10atars for this regardless of what breast pump you may have!!
customer_reviews.author: Monique Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Best so far
customer_reviews.text: I’m 9 months into my pumping journey, I’ve been freezing milk since day one. The hospital gave me a large supply of the other name brand starting with an “L” and when I started going through my stash to rotate those other bags would leak while being defrosted. Then I tried these and NO LEAKS! They hold 6 ounces perfectly, I wouldn’t put more than that since you want them to freeze flat for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Allie Amor

customer_reviews.title: Storage Bags
customer_reviews.text: Ok this is the thing... I bought my first pair of breast milk storage bags at Target about 2 weeks ago.. I gotta say I like them. They are leakage proof even if laid down and they are great as far as labelling date and time which is a huge need for me since I always forget... The only thing I dislike is the fact that the accuracy is way off.. It never shows the true amount in the bag. So I have to keep track but idk besides that I don't really see a issue . I would gift them
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Poleth B

customer_reviews.title: No holes in the bags to put your pump in. EXTRA STEP
customer_reviews.text: This is JUST bags. You can't put your pump in the top and pump straight into the bag. I have an older pump so maybe they don't make it that way anymore. But this is a whole extra step to have to pump in the container, then pour it in the bag to freeze, then I have to wash the container. I was in a bind but I wish I'd just returned them because there's so many.
customer_reviews.author: AqUdy1

customer_reviews.title: Eh they're okay.
customer_reviews.text: I really didnt like these bags. I had only gotten these because they were on sale a little cheaper than the parents choice brand bags. They are a weird plastic, kind of felt like cellophane (that's the only way I can think to describe it). They also dont lay super flat because the bags are kind of short so they end up taking up a little more room in the freezer. I had a hard time getting all the air out of the bags too. They do the job but I honestly wouldnt use these again unless I had too.
customer_reviews.author: Lewiemama

customer_reviews.title: These are horrible milk bags
customer_reviews.text: Figured cause it was a good brand that these would be good bags, but they're the worst I've used. They're stiff and hard to open, even harder coming out of the freezer you have to use scissors. I don't even want to use the rest of the them but I hate wasting money, tempted just to throw them away tho and count as a loss. I will never order these again
customer_reviews.author: Mama Young

customer_reviews.title: Safely stores larger quantity of breastmilk
customer_reviews.text: These work to store my breastmilk neatly. I wish it was easier to pump directly into the bag, without extra pump accessories. For accuracy, make sure bag is fully expanded. Also, be careful not to spill when pouring into bottles - make sure there are no wrinkles in the bag first! I do like not having to wash bottles conatantly!
customer_reviews.author: awfullyrad

customer_reviews.title: They leak .
customer_reviews.text: I personally like the parents choice and lansinoh breastmilk bags way better. These it says 6 oz on it but you can fit up to 7ish but my main problem is when you go to seal them..... I’ve had 5 bags leak in a 50 pack and I won’t buy these again because that’s an easy 30 oz wasted because these leak. I never have that issue with parents choice from Walmart or the lansinoh bags.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Not as flat as lansinoh
customer_reviews.text: The bag seems thicker. But not easy to poll the milk in from the bottle. I use bottles to measure milk because the scale in bags is not accurate. Those bags are not as flat as Lansinoh bags. I attached pictures here. Both bags with 6 oz milk. Which means I’ll need more space to store my milk with Medela bags. Nothing wrong but I’ll switch back to Lansinoh.
customer_reviews.author: MyraZha

customer_reviews.title: Bags leak all of the time! So much milk wasted
customer_reviews.text: These bags were easy to store, however almost 1/3 of them leaked and had to be thrown away when I tried to use them for my baby! When the bag was placed in a bottle warmer as they were made to be, they would begin leaking. Not sure if tears occurred when milk froze or bag was just weak. Would not recommend as frozen milk is precious and having so much wasted was really frustrating as I wasn’t able to give it to my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole D

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for leakage.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed in these bags! They constantly leak when thawing out. The first bag that leaked, I thought ok, it’s plastic. Out of 100 bags, it’s bound to happen to one or two. Ok, 32 total bags have leaked in the warmer! My precious liquid gold is completely wasted. I’m so angry at these bags that I could spit FIRE.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Not cut out to pump directly into bag.
customer_reviews.text: I love that these are larger and the seem very durable. However the do not have a cut out to hang on the medela pump adapters so I can pump directly into the bag. I still use them by cutting a space myself but it’s an extra step I don’t really want to have to take. Pumping is hard enough withou remembering I need scissors too.
customer_reviews.author: Stephy

customer_reviews.title: Smaller bags that are harder to open than other brands.
customer_reviews.text: I am exclusively pumping. I use bags for milk storage during the day and for freezing. I have tried many brands, and these bags were my least favorite. They were fine in that they functioned. I don't like how hard they were to open, they don't store as much milk for carrying around as other brands, and the opening in the top seems smaller. They worked fine. They were sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: A Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Stands up for filling, has not leaked
customer_reviews.text: With our first baby we got the cheaper Lansinoh bags and they leaked without fail when thawing from the freezer. This time I'm splurging on the Medelas and two boxes in and one has yet to leak. They stand up well when filling (I hold them anyways), freeze flat, and thaw out cleanly. More expensive but worth it in amount of liquid gold saved.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great bags!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I’m just now finding these! You have to cut off the top to open them and you can’t pump directly into the bags, but these are almost HALF the price of the other Medela bags, and these hold 6oz. So if you’re ok with pumping into bottles and pouring into bags, then these are perfect, bigger, and so much more cost efficient!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR LIQUID GOLD
customer_reviews.text: I have saved almost 1500 oz of milk for my baby and only to realize later that they have a strong chemical smell. My son would not drink it and we forced him not knowing it’s the smell that bothers him. Thawed a bag from almost everyday that were stored in freezer and they smell the same. I am just so mad on all the liquid gold that got wasted cuz I have put so much hard work into it. 😰. PLEASE BEWARE. Using Lasinoh ones and they smell good
customer_reviews.author: Eva Smile Prathipaty

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great! I have only had one leak issue where the bag tore but that was because I filled a little bit over the suggested amount smh and your milk expands as it freezes. The double zipper ensures that it won't leak through from the top. They also lie pretty flat so it doesn't take up too much space and they can stand on their own if you need them too. The count to me is not completely accurate but it is not off by a noticeable amount.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy plastic but terrible for storage space
customer_reviews.text: I just don't like the plastic, it's harder and when it freezes it is not flat but always seems to bulge on the bottom so when I am storing rows of them I get so many less in a row than other brands. I've also had more accidents of lost milk when pouring into these than any other bags.
customer_reviews.author: UserVerifiedReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good seal, no leaks
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are easy to use, seal closed and don't leak, good zip lock seal. That being said, it was never alligned with the bottle in terms of oz on the bag vs oz it filled up in the bottle. I'm not sure why or how and I tried to make sure the bag was fully opened when pouting milk in, then sealing it, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of a product (leaky and adds smell)
customer_reviews.text: This is such a badly designed and manufactured product!! I had ordered two boxes for Pumping when travel and at work. Almost half the bags leaked and I lost precious milk of my little one!! It does not give means for using the Madela adapter as well!! The amount of milk I wasted in using these awful bags was made worse by the smell it adds to the milk stored in these bags. Waste of money, time, efforts and little ones milk!!
customer_reviews.author: Manasi Khare

customer_reviews.title: Dose not show correct oz
customer_reviews.text: I have Medela bottles and when I pour it over to the bags, the bags do NOT show the same oz at all, not even close. The bags are leak proof and easy to store in the fridge. They stand up well too. But it is a problem for me, that they dosen't show the correct amount. I really tried hard to figure out how to.
customer_reviews.author: Milla

customer_reviews.title: Great when frozen flat; ounce markers not really reliable
customer_reviews.text: I love these breastmilk storage bags, and they have never ever leaked for me in the 3+ months I've been using them. They are great for freezing flat and storing organized upright by date. My only complaint is that the ounce measurements are not reliable or accurate, so I have to measure in a bottle before pouring into the bags.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Parent

customer_reviews.title: Best Breastmilk Storage Bags
customer_reviews.text: I have used 3 brands of breast milk storage bags and these are the best! They are more durable, much easier for pouring and the thin plastic makes for easy heating in warm water. I have since switched to formula, but still use these bags for formula storage because it is much easier. I make a full-days batch and store it in 8-ounce bags for easy, ready-to-use bottles!!
customer_reviews.author: Chance Glover

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. However, some bags do have a factory smell to it when first opened, but i only found 2 bags so far and im down to my last 25 bags out of the 100. There was also 1 bag that leaked during defrost in warm water so I had to toss that one sadly. But overall out of the almost 75 I've used, im pretty satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Yang

customer_reviews.title: Not designed for easy use.
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the Lanisoh storage bags over these. The flaps above the zip lock portion of the bags aren’t cut on the sides, which makes it difficult to pour milk into the freezer bag without spilling. Also, if you don’t open the bag all the way with your hand or by blowing into it, the milk overflows and spills. Lanisoh freezer bags are much easier to use because they don’t have these problems.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Berendt Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Good milk bags
customer_reviews.text: My hakaa definitely has different measurements than the bags do, I don't use the measurements on the bags at all- they are also different when in bottles too. Other than that they work for what they need to. The only leaks we've had is from my husband not REALLY making sure they're closed all the way. Also, don't overfill or they will leak when thawed. We don't fill past 5 ounces.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lambres

customer_reviews.title: Best Milk Bags for Freezing
customer_reviews.text: I love these bags and will be reordering for a 3rd time. They stand up well, have a sturdy base for you to pour your milk into them. They seal super tight and freeze flat if needed. They also thaw well and I have no had one leak issue with any of the bags I have received. Overall they are the best I've found as well price-wise for the large packs. I would recommend for anyone whos pumping a lot and freezing milk.
customer_reviews.author: rgood

customer_reviews.title: Not for pumping into directly!
customer_reviews.text: These are awful to pump into. After recieving these and trying to pump into them I found a review saying the madela pump and save bags are for pumping. Why madela can't make that more clear in for product description and in the answered questions section the to question and response is about pumping into these bags and how you can.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Take up a lot of space when frozen
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy bags for a great price too! They are on the shorter side and made with super thick plastic- so very durable, but if you are filling with more than 4oz (claims it fits six) it freezes super wide. Trying to build my freezer stash and one bag is about as thick as two of my previous ones. Pictured: both bags contain 4.5 oz.
customer_reviews.author: McKay

customer_reviews.title: Really great price and nice layout
customer_reviews.text: These were very reasonably priced, much better deal than what I had previously purchased in the store. I also like these better than the other bags, especially the heading area. They are very easy to label and keep organized. They are also a good weight, and I like the tear off piece for keeping the bag clean. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hotmann

customer_reviews.title: Easy and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are holding up and close very securely, they stand up on their own. The only thing is pouring out while one handed (the other holding baby) it's a little difficult, a pouring system would have been better, but the lip is sturdy, so if you get it folded while open, just right, you can pour with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Urban

customer_reviews.title: Lots of leaking - super-disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine these were first-run or authentic Medela storage bags. I don't have a Medela pump, but I like these bags more than other brands, so I pump into bottles and transfer to the bags. About half of the bags in my last two shipments have leaked as they were thawing in the refrigerator, causing (obviously) us to waste milk and a mess in the refrigerator. Very disappointed, and I'm not sure I'll buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will be buying more
customer_reviews.text: Alot of reviews stated the bags leaked but I haven't had that problem at all! I love how easy these are to use and how sturdy they are! The ziploc seal is even heavy duty to ensure its sealed tightly. A tip for those of you who are apprehensive about leakage, when you go to unthaw your milk put your storage bag inside of a ziploc baggie to catch anything that may spill out just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Sherea

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I have used Target's generic brand, Lansinoh and now these, and I will just be working through this pack to use them up. I like the label a lot, it's streamlined and simple. My daycare also likes how durable the bags seem to be. I do think these are much more inaccurate that my previous bags, sometimes it seems like a half to full ounce off! I also have had a few leaking incidents with these :(
customer_reviews.author: Hannah G

customer_reviews.title: Do not leak!!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great. I’ve never had an issue leaking. I switched from lansioh bags after I lost so many oz from them leaking. Buy these if you don’t want you precious milk to be wasted. I wish they froze flat, that’s my only issue.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but, harder to use
customer_reviews.text: Got these to try as I have the medela pump and I been using lansinoh storage bags. These are differently stronger material than the lansinoh but, it is hard to use it to pump into the bag and the bottle does not open up for it to stand. You need to use both hands to open the bottle part.
customer_reviews.author: hoi yu

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when thawing frozen milk
customer_reviews.text: So I’m not sure if it was something I did wrong, but when I thawed milk from a month prior via the fridge, I would sometimes (not always) end up with a fridge shelf full on milk. Again, could have been user error but once it thawed enough, I would use one if the shields from my pump as a funnel, and poured the “slushy” milk into a medela storage bottle to let it finish thawing. Extra step that’s annoying, but better piece of mind that way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have been usign the Medela bags since the birth of my first child. They are absolutely the best. They are leak proof with a very hard sealed opening and they are made with a very good quality plastic. I use them to store my breast milk, pump directly into them with my Medela pumps (with the special attachments) and I also store puree food. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Andrea G.

customer_reviews.title: Good product that gets the jobs done
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good. This is my first baby so I don't know how other brands work but these get the job done for me. The measurements on the bag seem to be a little off because it really depends on how you hold it. I hate the way that they pour; you have to be so careful not to spill any milk as you transfer it into the bottles. If I can find a way to fix this issue I will update my review. Overall, I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: H Waller

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Usually Medela products are on the higher end of the price spectrum for what you get but not so with these bags. They have a double ziplock and I like how they have a sturdier thickness for when I’m pouring milk into them—not afraid the bag will collapse and my goods will splatter all over the counter :) I have also used Lansinoh, Nuk and Gerber bags. These are my favorite because of bag sturdiness, double zip, and price.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie D

product_meta.title: Medela Breast Milk Storage Bags, 100 Count, Ready to Use Breastmilk Bags for Breastfeeding, Self Standing Bag, Space Saving Flat Profile, Hygienically Pre-Sealed, 6 Ounce
product_meta.description:
Size:100 Count

Pumping breastmilk is a vital function for new mothers. Keeping the breastmilk safe and ready to store for future use helps to keep your baby healthy. This is why Medela has created these double-zipper and hygienically sealed breastmilk ready to use storage bags. The Medela Breast Milk Storage Bags have been hygienically pre-sealed with durable material and double-zipper protection to prevent leaking. These bags safely store breastmilk in the freezer, fridge, or when traveling. These ready to use breastmilk storage bags are constructed from a durable, double-layer material with a built-in double zipper seal to keep your breastmilk safely stored in the fridge or freezer.

The Medela breastmilk storage bags have been designed to be self-standing and come with a large write-on area. This allows you to document the date and other vital information for safer storage and use. Also, the Medela Breast Milk large 6-ounce Storage Bags have been designed to lay flat for space-saving storage. This unique feature allows quick thawing of frozen milk when your baby is hungry. To help you keep these breastmilk storage bags clean and organized, we’ve added a bonus resealable transport pouch that keeps unused bags organized and clean.

Medela offers two types of storage bags to fit your lifestyle. Our new breast milk storage bags are for moms looking for save only bags and who don't need or want to pump directly into the bag, while our Pump & Save bags are designed for moms who want the added convenience of pumping directly into the bag. With either choice, we've got you covered. Medela’s primary focus is on helping moms to successfully breastfeed their babies for as long as they choose. Meeting this goal responsibly is at the heart of everything we do.
feature_bullets: HYGIENICALLY PRE-SEALED: The Medela Breast Milk Storage Bags have been hygienically pre-sealed with durable material and double-zipper protection to prevent leaking. These bags safely store breastmilk in the freezer, fridge, or when traveling.

DURABLE DOUBLE-LAYER MATERIAL: These ready to use breastmilk storage bags are constructed from a durable double-layer material and built-in double zipper seal to keep your breastmilk safely stored in the fridge or freezer.
SELF-STANDING DESIGN: Our breastmilk storage bags are self-standing and come with a large write-on area, so you can document the date and other vital information for safer storage and use.

LAY FLAT PROFILE: The Medela Breast Milk large 6-ounce Storage Bags have been designed to lay flat for space-saving storage. This unique feature also allows quick thawing of frozen milk.The bags are made from food-grade, BPA free material
BONUS RESEALABLE TRANSPORT POUCH: To help you keep these breastmilk storage bags clean and organized, we’ve added a bonus resealable transport pouch.
